tool.name: Scatter Plot 3D
tool.description: A standalone tool for 3D Scatter Plots.
tool.command:
scatter_plot_3D.py --input $input --ID $uniqID
--X $x --Y $y --Z $z --figure $figure --pca $pca
#if $design --design $design #end if
#if $group --group $group #end if
#if $paletteGroup --palette_group $paletteGroup #end if
#if $palette --palette $palette #end if
#if $rotation --rotation $rotation #end if
#if $elevation --elevation $elevation #end if

param.name: input
param.label: Wide Dataset
param.help: Input dataset in wide format and tab separated. If file is not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: uniqID
param.label: Unique Feature ID
param.help: Name of the column in your Wide Dataset that has unique Feature IDs.

param.name: x
param.label: X Group Title
param.help: Name of the column for X values.

param.name: y
param.label: Y Group Title
param.help: Name of the column for Y values.

param.name: z
param.label: Z Group Title
param.help: Name of the column for Z values.

param.name: pca
param.label: Use PCA Data?
param.help: Using a PCA output or standard dataset.

param.name: rotation
param.label: Camera rotation for viewing [Optional]
param.help: Ideal viewing rotation may be a process of trial and error.

param.name: elevation
param.label: Camera elevation for viewing [Optional]
param.help: Ideal viewing elevation may be a process of trial and error.

param.name: design
param.label: Design File [Optional]
param.help: Design file tab separated. Note you need a 'sampleID' column. If not tab separated see TIP below.

param.name: group
param.label: Group/Treatment [Optional]
param.help: Name of the column in your Design File that contains group classifications.

tool.help:
@TIP_AND_WARNING@
**Tool Description**
The tool provides a 3D scatter plot of your data. User has option to plot the outputs produced by other tools such as the principal component analysis (PCA) tool, the random forest (RF) tool as well as datasets uploaded by user. NOTE: The user also has an option to choose the color palette if he/she does not have the default one using the web site: http://www.palettable.io/
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Input**
- Two input datasets are required.
@WIDE@
**NOTE:** The sample IDs must match the sample IDs in the Design File (below). Extra columns will automatically be ignored.
@UNIQID@
**X Group Title**
- Name of the column for X values.
**Y Group Title**
- Name of the column for Y values.
**Z Group Title**
- Name of the column for Z values.
**Use PCA Data?**
- Using a PCA output or standard dataset.
**Camera rotation for viewing [Optional]:**
- Ideal viewing rotation may be a process of trial and error.
**Camera elevation for viewing [Optional]:**
- Ideal viewing elevation may be a process of trial and error.
@METADATA@
@GROUP_OPTIONAL@
**Palette Group [Optional]**
- See Palettable's website.
**Palette [Optional]**
- See Palettable's website.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Output**
The too produces a PDF file with the 3D scatter plot. The coloring of the features by group and corresponding legend will be included in the plot if the user provide the design file and grouping variable.
